body.p:
Though not your correspondent I still take the
liberty to gratify your desire and inform you of the reason of Dr
Illowy's refusing a reelection after he had affected so much good in
the Congregation.

In the outset I beg leave to make you acquainted with
the new circumstances as they are now prevailing in our midst. Our
Cong. Schaarey Chased was originally founded a orthodox Cong.
still we had not more than the mere name in reality however we
were nothing תפילין ציצית ומזוזות our fine Synagogue was empty on
Sabbath and Holydays and it was not seldom the case that
the reader had to stop and wait a considerable time before the
due number of worshippers was complete. Over ten or eleven persons
never (the day of atonemet excepted) attended divine service שוחט
were useless and unknown articles; among several hundred children
there were not ten who could read a hebrew word and no religious
education was given to them; the never pronounced the glorious name
of God except when swearing or cursing; of the History of their
nation they knew no more than that they were jews, and this
they only learned from their christian schoolmates who called them
so. There was but one עיר הנידחת for the four Congs. whose members live
scattered all over this large city. The „ ladies Gallery “ was in such a
state that every decent man was bound to keep his eyes fixed to the ground
lest by an unintended glimpse on the gallery he should violate
the laws of decency and respect due to the sacred abode.

Yes New Orleans was at time not much better than an שוחט
there was no religious superindendant and the שבת and butcher
acted just according to their pleasure.

From all these and a good many other evils Dr Illowy healed
the Cong. immediately at his arrival. The President S. Fried
ler Esq supported him with all his ? might and influence and
in a very short time he succeeded in establishing a Sabbath's
rest in the Cong; over eighty wholesale and retail merchants closed at once
their places of business on שוחט; the house of worship was crowdedly
every Sabbath; the railing around the Ladies Gallery was draped
from inside
and assistant תפילין ציצית מזוזות תפילות וחמשים was engaged and peddler with
שוחטים commenced to make elegant business here.
The שבת had to subject to the rules of their Superintendant
and the butchers who sell on סוכות had to have their meat sealed
with a seal procured by the Cong. for that purpose.

The word of God was taught and expounded every Sabbath by
Revd Dr Illowy in a very able and eloquent manner and his
words fell upon many a bless fertile heart and yielded blissful
fruits. Besides a sunday sunday school, we have yet two large day
schools in which besides all the higher school branches taught
therein by competent and experienced teachers, the utmost care and
and attention are paid to the religious education of our children, as
instruction in hebrew reading, translating the bible and the prophets
the History of our Nation from the time of Abram to the
destruction of the second temple. The great change in our religious life
could best be seen last והאספסוף התאוו תאבה when there were ove fifty tabernacles
in the city whilst when Dr Illowy arrived here there was but one.

But while we were greatly rejoiced at our great success, our rapid
progress was suddenly checked by a party of young men the most
of them hailing from the North, who came to this city a few years
ago and formed an association under the title of the “Deutche
Company.” This society increased rapidle during the last two years
קדושה and became numerous enough for the daring
enterprise to build a large and gorgeous reform Temple, which should
eclipse in magnificence that of Jerusalem and in comparison to
which the great Temple of New York should be as the hut of the
esquimaux?, to the royal palace of Napoleon, in the upper part
of this city. Meetings were held for that purpose officers elected
committees appointed and circulars sent around to all the Hebrews
in this city, and many reform friends and mal-contents joined the
Association

Already every one young and old began to see gay visions of a
fashionable divine service. Family pews Ladies and Gentleman
together, beautiful choirs, operatic music, airs form “Robt Le Diable”
to the אן כאלהנו airs from the “Barber of Seville” adapted to the
Hebrew and many other pleasant things too numerous to mention

But when after all the exerted efforts they discovered secession to
be a failure, they gave up their first plan as empracticable & a
new one and indeed a very ingenious one was formed. The most
of their members tried and succeeded to become members of the Cong
Schaarey Chased. the board of officers who accepted them, not
dreaming like Joshua when he made a treaty of peace
with the Gideonites, that any harm was meant by their
joining into the Cong., and but too late the found out
that they had run into a snare. The reform friends have no

need any more of building a new Temple, they will realize
all their fine visions without any expense, they have now a
majority in the Cong. and will use the fine edifice of the
Rampart St Synagogue for their purpose, and the old
members who will not agree with the to the new order of things
can build themselves another Synagogue. Now they went to work
the meanest and foulest tricks were set in operation for the purpose
of removing all the faithfull men from the administration, and
they succeeded. Mr Friedlander who for 4 years worked indefatigab
ly for this Cong. was most ungratefully treated, provoked and
constantly vexed untill he left with disgust the chair and resigned.
This was just what they wanted. Mr Klopman and Mr Lehman
followed his example, and the field being thus all at once evacuated
the invaders took possession of it elected as President the man of their
choice, fully fit to answer their purposes, and a certain individual
who since years past indulged in the habit of keeping his hand
in the pocket of the Cong. shouts and rejoices now at the great victory of
the liberals.

Dr Illowy seeing the approaching storm brooding over the
orthodox party of our Cong. did not desire to wait untill it would
discharge its destructive contents, for he foresaw that the people of the
would conquer and the old and the old Southerners be subjugated;
he resigned therefore at the at proper time with the best satisfaction in his heart
of having faithfully discharged all his duties and with a firm
adherence to his principles and the doctrines of our fathers
Atty. At Law. No 33 Exchange place.
